CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 13, 1958, pg. 2, reads: "Ministers' Committee Fights Vice - Deeply concerned by the recent slaying of a 16-year-old youth in a teen-age gang fight, and Interdenominational Ministers' Committee, of 15 clergymen, representing a cross-section of the city's religious leadership, met Monday, at Central Baptist Church, and mapped plans for an all-out fight against vice and crime in community. A permanent anti-vice organization will be organized later.  Ministers attending Monday's meeting and listening to the Rev. S. Amos Bracken of Shiloh Baptist Church, explaining the need for such an organization, were: the Revs. Cornell E. Talley, Central Baptist Church; Ramsey Bridges, Warren M. E. Church; Charles H. Foggie, Wesley Center AME Zion Church; Jethro Lester, Seventh Day Adventist Church; C. M. Morgan, Lincoln Ave. Church of God; J. G. Harris, Bethel AME Church; B. S. Mason, St. Luke Baptist Church; William J. Harvey III, Macedonia Baptist Church; W. D. Petett, Nazarene Baptist Church; J. A. Cox, Calvary Baptist Church; J. C. Hairston, Sixth Mt. Zion Baptist Church, J. B. Cayce, Ebenezer Baptist Church; J. W. Twiggs, Monumental Baptist Church, and Porter W. Phillips of Carron Baptist Church. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Rev. S. Amos Bracken addressing Interdenominational Ministers Committee against crime and vice, including Revs. Cornell E. Talley, Ramsey Bridges, Charles H. Foggie, Jethro Lester, C. M. Morgan, J. G. Harris, B. S. Mason, William J. Harvey III, W. D. Petett, J. A. Cox, J. C. Hairston, J. B. Cayce, J. W. Twiggs, and Porter W. Phillips, in Central Baptist Church
